lines.value: casualties some 63 million people or 3% of the world population died in the war though estimates vary about 24 million soldiers and 38 million civilians
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: this total includes the estimated 9 million lives lost in the holocaust
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: of the total deaths in world war ii approximately 80% were on the allied side and 20% on the axis side
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: allied forces suffered approximately 17 million military deaths of which about 11 million were soviet and 3 million chinese
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: axis forces suffered about 8 million of which more than 5 million were german
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: in total of the military deaths in world war ii approximately 44% were soviet soldiers 22% were german 12% were chinese 8% were japanese 9% were soldiers of other allied forces and 5% were other axis country soldiers
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: some modern estimates double the number of chinese casualties originally stated
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: of the civilian deaths approximately 90% were allied nearly a third of all civilians killed were soviet citizens and more than 15% of all civilians killed in the war died in german extermination camps and 10% were axis
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: many civilians died as a result of disease starvation massacres genocide--in particular the holocaust--and aerial bombing
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: one estimate is that 12 million civilians died in holocaust camps 1.5 million by bombs 7 million in europe from other causes and 7.5 million in china from other causes
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: allied civilian deaths totaled roughly 38 million including 11.7 million in the soviet union 7 million in china and 5.2 million from poland
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: there were around 3 million civilian deaths on the axis side including 2 million in germany and 0.6 million in japan
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the holocaust refers to the organized state sponsored murder of 6 million jews 1.8-1.9 million non jewish poles 200000-800000 roma people 200000-300000 people with disabilities and other groups carried out by the nazis during the war
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the soviet union suffered by far the largest death toll of any nation in the war over 23 million
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: genocide the holocaust was the organized murder of an estimated nine million people including approximately six million jews
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: originally the nazis used killing squads known as einsatzgruppen to conduct massive open air killings shooting as many as 33000 people in a single massacre as in the case of babi yar
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: by 1942 the nazi leadership decided to implement the final solution or endlosung the genocide of all jews in europe and to increase the pace of the holocaust
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the nazis built six extermination camps specifically to kill jews
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: millions of jews who had been confined to massively overcrowded ghettos were transported to these death camps in which they were either slaughtered on arrival or put to work until the nazis could find no more use for them at which point they were put to death by shooting or mass poisoning in gas chambers
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: chemical and bacteriological weapons despite the international treaties and a resolution adopted by the league of nations on 14 may 1938 condemning the use of toxic gas by japan the imperial japanese army frequently used chemical weapons
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: because of fears of retaliation however those weapons were never used against occidentals but only against other orientals judged inferior by the imperial propaganda
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: according to historians yoshiaki yoshimi and seiya matsuno the authorization for the use of chemical weapons was given by specific orders rinsanmei issued by hirohito himself
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: for example the emperor authorized the use of toxic gas on 375 separate occasions during the invasion of wuhan from august to october 1938
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the bacteriological weapons were experimented on human beings by many units incorporated in the japanese army such as the infamous unit 731 integrated by imperial decree in the kwantung army in 1936
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: those weapons were mainly used in china and according to some japanese veterans against mongolians and russian soldiers in 1939 during the nomonhan incident
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: cannibalism many written reports and testimony collected by the australian war crimes section of the tokyo tribunal and investigated by prosecutor william webb the future judge in chief indicate that japanese soldiers committed cannibalism on prisoners
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: according to historian yuki tanaka cannibalism was often a systematic activity conducted by whole squads and under the command of officers
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: pakistani pow hatam ali testified that at this stage the japanese started selecting prisoners and everyday 1 prisoner was taken out and killed and eaten by the soldiers
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: i personally saw this happen and about 100 prisoners were eaten at this place by the japanese
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the remainder of us were taken to another spot 50 miles away where 10 prisoners died of sickness
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: at this place the japanese again started selecting prisoners to eat
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: those selected were taken to a hut where their flesh was cut from their bodies while they were alive and they were thrown into a ditch where they later died indian pow havildar changdi ram testified that on 12 november 1944 the kempei tai beheaded the pilot
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: i saw this from behind a tree and watched some of the japanese cut flesh from his arms legs hips buttocks and carry it off to their quarters they cut it in small pieces and fried it apart from written orders referring to cannibalism the japanese sources provide testimonies such as the one given by major matoba to the us military commission of august 1946 convened by the navy commander of guam and marianna islands which refer to meat of an american soldier served for supper to general tachibana of the 307 infantry battalion on 25 february 1945
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: slave labor according to a joint study of historians featuring zhifen ju mark peattie toru kubo and mitsuyochi himeta more than 10 million chinese were mobilized by the japanese army and enslaved by the koa-in for slave labor in manchukuo and north china
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: according to mitsuyoshi himeta at least 2.7 million died during the sanko sakusen operation implemented in heipei and shantung by general yasuji okamura
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: concentration camps labour camps and internment in addition to the nazi concentration camps the soviet gulag or labor camps led to the death of citizens of occupied countries such as poland lithuania latvia and estonia as well as german prisoners of war pow and even soviet citizens themselves who had been supporters of the nazis
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: japanese pow camps also had high death rates many were used as labour camps and starvation conditions among the mainly us british australian and other commonwealth prisoners were little better than many german concentration camps
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: sixty percent 1238000 ref
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: krivosheev of soviet pows died during the war
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: vadim erlikman puts it at 2.6 million soviet pows that died in german captivity
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: richard overy gives the number of 5.7 million soviet pow and out of those 57% died or were killed
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: furthermore 150000 japanese americans were interned by the us and canadian governments as well as nearly 11000 german and italian residents of the us war crimes from 1945 to 1951 german and japanese officials and personnel were prosecuted for war crimes
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: top german officials were tried at the nuremberg trials and many japanese officials at the tokyo war crime trial and other war crimes trials in the asia pacific region
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: resistance during world war ii occurred in every occupied country by a variety of means ranging from non cooperation disinformation and propaganda to outright warfare
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: among the most notable resistance movements were the polish home army the french maquis the yugoslav partisans the greek resistance force and the italian resistance in the german occupied northern italy after 1943
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: germany itself also had an anti nazi movement
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the communist resistance was among the fiercest since they were already organised and militant even before the war and they were ideologically opposed to the nazis
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: before d day there were some operations performed by the french resistance to help with the forthcoming invasion
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: communications lines were cut trains were derailed roads water towers and ammunition depots were destroyed and some german garrisons were attacked
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: there were also resistance movements fighting against the allied invaders
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the german resistance petered out within a few years while in the baltic states resistance operations against the occupation continued into the 1960s
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: home front is the name given to the activities of the civilians of the nations at war
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: all the main countries reorganized their homefronts to produce munitions and soldiers with 40-60% of gdp being devoted to the war effort
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: women were drafted in the soviet union and britain
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: shortages were everywhere and severe food shortages caused malnutrition and even starvation such as in the netherlands and in leningrad
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: new workers were recruited especially housewives the unemployed students and retired people
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: skilled jobs were reengineered and simplified de-skilling so that unskilled workers could handle them
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: every major nation imposed censorship on the media as well as a propaganda program designed to boost the war effort and stifle negative rumors
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: every major country imposed a system of rationing and price controls
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: black markets flourished in areas controlled by germany
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: germany brought in millions of prisoners of war slave laborers and forced workers to staff its munitions factories
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: many were killed in the bombing raids the rest became refugees as the war ended
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: weapons and technology improved rapidly during world war ii and some of these played a crucial role in determining the outcome of the war
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: many major technologies were used for the first time including nuclear weapons radar proximity fuses jet engines ballistic missiles and data processing analog devices primitive computers
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: every year the piston engines were improved
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: enormous advances were made in aircraft submarine and tank designs such that models coming into use at the beginning of the war were long obsolete by its end
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: one entirely new kind of ship was the amphibious landing craft
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: industrial production played a role in the allied victory
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the allies more effectively mobilized their economies and drew from a larger economic base
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the peak year of munitions production was 1944 with the allies out producing the axis by a ratio of 3 to 1
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: germany produced 19% and japan 7% of the world's munitions the us produced 47% britain and canada 14% and the soviets 11%
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the allies used low cost mass production techniques using standardized models
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: japan and germany continued to rely on expensive hand crafted methods
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: japan thus produced hundreds of airplane designs and did not reach mass production efficiency the new models were only slightly better than the original 1940 planes while the allies rapidly advanced in technology
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: germany thus spent heavily on high tech weaponry including the v 1 flying bomb and v 2 rocket advanced submarines jet engines and heavy tanks that proved strategically of minor value
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the combination of better logistics and mass production proved crucial in the victory
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the allies did not depend on simple numbers for victory but on the quality of their technology and the fighting effectiveness of their forces in both germany and japan less emphasis was placed upon the non combat areas of war procurement logistics military services concludes historian richard overy
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: delivery of weapons to the battlefront was a matter of logistics
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the allies again did a much better job in moving munitions from factories to the front lines
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: a large fraction of the german tanks after june 1944 never reached the battlefield and those that did often ran short of fuel
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: japan in particular was notably inefficient in its logistics system
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: many new medical and surgical techniques were employed as well as new drugs like sulfa and penicillin not to mention serious advances in biological warfare and nerve gases
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the japanese control of the quinine supply forced the australians to invent new anti malarial drugs
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the saline bath was invented to treat burns
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: more prompt application of sulfa drugs saved countless lives
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: new local anesthetics were introduced making possible surgery close to the front lines
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the americans discovered that only 20% of wounds were cause by machine gun or rifle bullets compared to 35% in world war i
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: most came from high explosive shells and fragments which besides the direct wound caused shock from their blast effects
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: most deaths came from shock and blood loss which were countered by a major innovation blood transfusions
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the massive research and development demands of the war accelerated the growth of the scientific communities in allied states while german and japanese laboratories were disbanded many german engineers and scientists continued their weapons research after the war in the united states and the soviet union
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the war concluded with the surrender and occupation of germany and japan
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: it left behind millions of displaced persons and prisoners of war and resulted in many new international boundaries
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the economies of europe china and japan were largely destroyed as a result of the war
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: to prevent or at least minimize future conflicts the allied nations led by the united states formed the united nations in san francisco california in 1945
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the end of the war hastened the independence of many british crown colonies such as india and dutch territories such as indonesia and the formation of new nations and alliances throughout asia and africa
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the philippines were granted their independence in 1946 as previously promised by the united states
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: poland's boundaries were redrawn to include portions of pre war germany including east prussia and upper silesia while ceding most of the areas taken by the soviet union in the molotov ribbentrop partition of 1939 effectively moving poland to the west
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: germany was split into four zones of occupation and the three zones under the western allies was reconstituted as a constitutional democracy
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the soviet union's influence increased as they established hegemony over most of eastern europe and incorporated parts of finland and poland into their new boundaries
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: europe was informally split into western and soviet spheres of influence which heightened existing tensions between the two camps and helped establish the cold war
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: in asia the imperial japanese empire's government was dismantled under general douglas macarthur and replaced by a constitutional monarchy with the emperor as a figurehead
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the defeat of japan led to the independence of korea which was split into two parts by the russian and american forces
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the war greatly enhanced china's international prestige but severely weakened chiang kai shek's central government and the armed forces of the republic of china
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: partly because of this in the subsequent chinese civil war the chinese nationalists lost and were forced to retreat to taiwan while the chinese communists established the people's republic of china on the mainland in 1949
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: world war ii also spawned many new technologies such as advanced aircraft radar jet engines synthetic rubber and plastics antibiotics like penicillin helicopters nuclear energy rocket technology and computers
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: these technologies were applied to government commercial industrial private and civil use
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: germany was partitioned into four zones of occupation coordinated by the allied control council
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the american british and french zones joined in 1949 as the federal republic of germany and the soviet zone became the german democratic republic
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: in germany economic suppression and denazification took place
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: millions of germans and poles were expelled from their homelands as a result of the territorial annexations in eastern europe agreed upon at the yalta and potsdam conferences
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: in the west alsace lorraine was given to france which also separated the saar area from germany
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: austria was separated from germany and divided into four zones of occupation which were united in 1955 to become the republic of austria
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: japan was occupied by the us aided by commonwealth troops until the peace treaty took effect in 1952
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the defeat of japan also lead to the eastablishment of the far eastern commission which set out policies for japan to fullfill under the terms of surrender
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: in accordance with the yalta conference agreements the soviet union occupied and subsequently annexed sakhalin
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: korea was divided between the us and the soviet union leading to the creation of two separate governments in 1948
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: in europe at the end of the war millions of civilians were homeless the economy had collapsed and 70% of the industrial infrastructure was destroyed
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the soviet union was also heavily affected with 30% of its economy destroyed
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the united kingdom ended the war economically exhausted by the war effort
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the wartime coalition government was dissolved new elections were held and churchill was defeated in a landslide general election by the labour party under clement attlee
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: in 1947 us secretary of state george marshall devised the european recovery program better known as the marshall plan
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: effective from 1948 to 1952 it allocated 13 billion dollars for the reconstruction of western europe
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: at the end of the war the soviet union occupied much of central and eastern europe and the balkans
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: in all the ussr occupied countries with the exception of austria the soviet union helped communist regimes to power
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: it also annexed the baltic countries estonia latvia and lithuania
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the war was a pivotal point in china's history
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: before the war against japan china had suffered nearly a century of humiliation at the hands of various imperialist powers and was relegated to a semi colonial status
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: however the war greatly enhanced china's international status
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: not only was the central government under chiang kai shek able to abrogate most of the unequal treaties china had signed in the past century the republic of china also became a founding member of the united nations and a permanent member in the security council
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: china also reclaimed manchuria and taiwan
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: भोंडला हा पश्चिम महाराष्ट्रात व कोकणात प्रचलित असलेला स्त्रियांच्या सामुदायिक खेळाचा प्रकार आहे नवरात्रीचे नऊ दिवस आणि दसऱ्याच्या दिवशी हा खेळला जातो.घटस्थापनेच्या दिवसापासून संध्याकाळी अंगणात भोंडला खेळला जातो.एका पाटावर हत्ती काढून त्याची पूजा करतात त्याभोवती फेर धरुन छोट्या मुली व शाळेतल्या मुली भोंडल्याची पारंपरिक गाणी म्हणतात.जिच्या घरी भोंडला असतो तिची आई खिरापत करते रोज बहुधा वेगळे घर आणि त्यामुळे वेगळी खिरापत असते म्हणजे पहिल्या दिवशी १ दुसऱ्या दिवशी २ अशा करत करत ९ व्या दिवशी ९ + १ खिरापत असते फेर धरताना एक छोट्या मुलींचा व १ मोठ्या मुलींचा असे २ फेरे होतात.सर्वच मुली गाणी म्हणतात शेवटी गोड की तिखट अशा तहाच्या वाटाघाटी सुरू झाल्या की जिचा भोंडला असयचा तिला अगदी धन्य वाटते

lines.value: टाइम्स ऑफ इंडिया चे वार्ताहार चिदानंद राजदत्त यांनी विकिपीडियाचे संस्थापक संस्थापक जिंबो वेल्स यांची भेट घेऊन भारतीय भाषिक मराठी,कन्नड आणि बंगाली विकिपीडियांच्या प्रगतीबद्दल माहिती घेऊन तिचा उल्लेख वेजेस ऑफ लँग्वेजेस आपल्या लेखात केला त्या पाठोपाठ राष्टीय प्रमुख दैनिक द हिंदूच्या वार्ताहार प्रीति जे यांनी पण से इट इन युवर लींगो या लेखात भारतीय भाषातील विकिपीडियांची दखल घेतली आता आजच्या टाईम्स ऑफ इंडियाच्या अग्रलेखान जागतिक प्रभावी ब्रँड्सच्या यादीत गूगल,ॲपल आणि यूट्युब या तिघांच्या पाठोपाठ विकिपीडिया एनसायक्लोपीडियाने चौथा क्रमांक पटकावल्याचा गौरवास्पद उल्लेख केला आहे.टाइम्स ऑफ इंडिया इट्स ईममटेरीअल अग्रलेखात म्हणते की फक्त हे गूगल,ॲपल,युट्यूब,विकिपीडिया फक्त आंतरजालावरील तारेच नाहीत तर ग्राहकांच्या गरजा ओळखण्याचा आणि अंतिम उपभोक्त्यावर संपूर्ण लक्ष केंद्रित करण्यासारखा कमिटमेंटचा मोठा विचार बिग आयडिया यात दिसून येतो सोप्या ,सुयोग्य व ग्राहकास मैत्रीपूर्ण वाटतील अशा सर्वकालीन मुद्यांचे महत्त्व या अग्रलेखात विषद केले आहे हा अग्रलेख वाचकांकरिता इ पेपर सदरातसुद्धा उपलब्ध केला गेला आहे
lines.name: Marathi

lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: या सर्व घटकांमध्ये नवीन भर पडली आहे ती म्हणजे जागतिक तापमानवाढ किंवा global warming
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: in the temperate and polar regions seasons are marked by changes in the amount of sunlight which in turn often cause cycles of dormancy in plants and hibernation in animals
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: these effects vary with latitude and with proximity to bodies of water
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: for example the south pole is in the middle of the continent of antarctica and therefore a considerable distance from the moderating influence of the southern oceans
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the north pole is in the arctic ocean and thus its temperature extremes are buffered by the presence of all that water
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the result is that the south pole is consistently colder during the southern winter than the north pole during the northern winter
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the cycle of seasons in the polar and temperate zones of one hemisphere is opposite to that in the other
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: when it is summer in the northern hemisphere it is winter in the southern hemisphere and vice versa and when it is spring in the northern hemisphere it is autumn in the southern hemisphere and vice versa
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: in the tropics there is no noticeable change in the amount of sunlight
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: however many regions famously the northern indian ocean are subject to monsoons rain and wind cycles
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: curiously a study of temperature records over the past 300 years david thompson science april 1995 shows that the climatic seasons and thus the seasonal year are governed by the anomalistic year rather than the tropical year
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: a common misconception is that within the arctic and antarctic circles the sun rises once in the spring and sets once in the fall thus the day and night are erroneously thought to last uninterrupted for 183 calendar days each
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: this is true only in the immediate region of the poles themselves
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: what does happen is that any point north of the arctic or south of the antarctic circle will have one period in the summer when the sun does not set and one period in the winter when the sun does not rise
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: at progressively higher latitudes the periods of midnight sun or midday dark for the other side of the globe are progressively longer
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: for example at the military and weather station called alert on the northern tip of ellesmere island canada about 450 nautical miles or 830 km from the north pole the sun begins to peek above the horizon in mid february and each day it climbs a bit higher and stays up a bit longer by 21 march the sun is up for 12 hours
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: however mid february is not first light
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the sky as seen from alert has been showing twilight or at least a pre dawn glow on the horizon for increasing hours each day for more than a month before that first sliver of sun appears
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: in the weeks surrounding 21 june the sun is at its highest and it appears to circle the sky without ever going below the horizon
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: eventually it does go below the horizon for progressively longer and longer periods each day until around the middle of october it disappears for the last time
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: for a few more weeks day is marked by decreasing periods of twilight
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: eventually for the weeks surrounding 21 december nothing breaks the darkness
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: in later winter the first faint wash of light briefly touches the horizon for just minutes per day and then increases in duration and pre dawn brightness each day until sunrise in february
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the date at which each season begins depends on how it is defined
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: in the united states the seasons are often considered to begin at the astronomical solstices and equinoxes these are sometimes known as the astronomical seasons
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: by this reckoning summer begins at summer solstice winter at winter solstice spring at the vernal equinox and autumn at the autumnal equinox
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: in britain the seasons are traditionally considered to begin about seven weeks earlier spring begins on candlemas summer on may day autumn on lammas and winter on all hallows
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the irish calendar uses almost the same reckoning spring begins on february 1 imbolc summer on may 1 beltane autumn on august 1 lughnasadh and winter on november 1 samhain
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: हिटलर हिटलरने स्थापन केलेल्या नाझी पक्षाचा सदस्य जर्मनी युरोप मध्ये दुसरे महायुद्ध , आणि होलोकॉस्ट केंद्रस्थानी होते .हिटलर त्यांनी 1919 मध्ये ( nsdap च्या नांदी ) जर्मन कामगार पक्ष सामील झाले महायुद्धाच्या इशांत एक decorated बुजुर्ग होते , आणि 1921 मध्ये nsdap नेता बनले
lines.name: Marathi

lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: 1924 मध्ये त्याचे प्रकाशन केल्यानंतर , हिटलर व्हर्साय च्या तह हल्ला आणि charismatic वक्तृत्वकला आणि हिटलरने स्थापन केलेल्या नाझी पक्षाचा सदस्य प्रचाराचे तंत्र सह पॅन जर्मानिझम , antisemitism , आणि विरोधी कम्युनिस्ट मतप्रणाली जाहिरात लोकप्रिय समर्थन लाभले
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: parts of abu dhabi were settled as far back as the 3rd millennium bc and its early history fits the nomadic herding and fishing pattern typical of the broader region
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: modern abu dhabi traces its origins to the rise of an important tribal confederation the bani yas in the late 18th century which also assumed control of dubai
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: in the 19th century the dubai and abu dhabi branches parted ways
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: into the mid 20th century the economy of abu dhabi continued to be sustained mainly by camel herding production of dates and vegetables at the inland oases of al ain and liwa and fishing and pearl diving off the coast of abu dhabi city which was occupied mainly during the summer months
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: most dwellings in abu dhabi city were at this time constructed of palm fronds barasti with the wealthier families occupying mud huts
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the growth of the cultured pearl industry in the first half of the twentieth century created hardship for residents of abu dhabi as pearls represented the largest export and main source of cash earnings
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: in 1939 sheikh shakhbut bin sultan al nahyan granted petroleum concessions and oil was first found in 1958
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: at first oil money had a marginal impact
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: a few lowrise concrete buildings were erected and the first paved road was completed in 1961 but sheikh shakbut uncertain whether the new oil royalties would last took a cautious approach preferring to save the revenue rather than investing it in development
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: his brother sheikh zayed bin sultan al nahyan saw that oil wealth had the potential to transform abu dhabi
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the ruling al nahyan family decided that sheikh zayed should replace his brother as ruler and carry out his vision of developing the country
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: on august 6 1966 with the assistance of the british sheikh zayed became the new ruler.[5] with the announcement by the uk in 1968 that it would withdraw from the persian gulf area by 1971 sheikh zayed became the main driving force behind the formation of the united arab emirates
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: after the emirates gained independence in 1971 oil wealth continued to flow to the area and traditional mud brick huts were rapidly replaced with banks boutiques and modern highrises
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: at present abu dhabi boasts the worlds highest absolute and per capita level of sovereign wealth funds calculated at usd 1000000.00 per inhabitant

lines.value: द्रविडचा जन्म मध्य प्रदेशातील इंदूर मध्ये एका मराठी कुटूंबात झाला त्याचे कुटूंब नंतर कर्नाटकमधील बंगळूर येथे स्थायिक झाली तेथेच तो लहानाचा मोठा झाला त्याची मातृभाषा मराठी आहे द्रविडचे वडील जॅम आणि प्रिझर्व्हज् बनविणार्‍या कंपनीत काम करीत त्यामुळे कालांतराने राहुलला जॅमी हे टोपणनाव पडले त्याची आई पुष्पा बंगळूर येथील विद्यापीठ विश्वेश्वरैया अभियांत्रिकी महाविद्यालयात वास्तुशास्त्राची प्राध्यापिका होती द्रविडला विजय नावाचा लहान भाऊ आहे बंगळूर येथील सेंट जोसेफ बॉइज हायस्कूलमध्ये त्याने शालेय शिक्षण घेतले तर सेंट जोसेफ कॉलेज ऑफ कॉमर्समधून त्याने वाणिज्य शाखेत पदवी घेतली सेंट जोसेफ कॉलेज ऑफ बिझनेस ॲडमिनीस्ट्रेशन येथे एमबीए करत असताना त्याची भारतीय क्रिकेट संघात निवड झाली

lines.value: १९९६ च्या विश्व चषक स्पर्धेनंतर लगेचच विनोद कांबळीच्या जागी संघात स्थान मिळवित द्रविडने त्याचे आंतरराष्ट्रीय पदार्पण ३ एप्रिल १९९६ रोजी श्रीलंकेविरूद्ध सिंगापूर येथील सिंगर चषक स्पर्धेच्या एकदिवसीय मालिकेत केले सामन्यात तो फलंदाजीत चमकदार कामगिरी करू शकला नाही मुथय्या मुरलीधरनने त्याला बाद करण्याआधी त्याने फक्त तीन धावा केल्या परंतू क्षेत्ररक्षण करताना त्याने २ झेल पकडले पाकिस्तानविरूद्ध दुसर्‍या सामन्यातही त्याच्या पदरी अपयश आले केवळ ४ धावा करून तो धावचित झाला सुरुवातीच्या चार सामन्यांमध्ये केवळ २१ धावांच्या कामगिरीमुळे द्रविडला एकदिवसीय संघातले आपले स्थान गमवावे लागले

lines.value: रवींद्रनाथकालीन भारतामध्ये सामाजिक राजकीय व सांस्कृतिक चळवळींचे प्रमुख केन्द्रांपैकी एक असलेल्या महाराष्ट्राचा प्रभाव रवींद्रनाथांवरही पडला होता संत तुकारामांच्या साहित्याचा त्यांनी अभ्यास केला होता संत तुकारामांचे काही अभंग त्यांनी बंगाली भाषेत अनुवादित केले आहेत रवींद्रनाथ अनुवादित तुकारामांचे अभंग कारवार येथील सृष्टिसौन्दर्यामुळे रवींद्रनाथांना आपल्या पहिल्या नाटकाची प्रेरणा मिळाली छत्रपती शिवाजी महाराजांचे जीवनही त्यांच्या साठी प्रेरणास्थान होते छत्रपती शिवाजी महाराजांवर त्यांनी एक खंडकाव्यही रचले आहे रवींद्रनाथांचा नेता व क्रांतिकारक या रूपांत भारतीय स्वातंत्र्य संग्रामात थेट सहभाग नव्हता म्हणून व त्यांच्या संस्कृतीपिपासू वृत्तीमुळे त्यांच्यावर महाराष्टात टीका झाली होती रवीन्द्रनाथांच्या व्यक्तिमत्त्वाने काही महाराष्ट्रीयही प्रभावित झाले होते रवीन्द्रसाहित्य मूळ बंगालीतून वाचण्याच्या इच्छेने पु.ल.देशपांडे हे बंगाली भाषा शिकले मराठी व कानडी भाषेत लेखन केलेले व कानडी भाषेतील आधुनिक साहित्यातील सर्वश्रेष्ठ कवी व जन्माने महाराष्ट्रीय असलेल्या द.रा बेन्द्रे यांच्या साहित्यावरही रवीद्रनाथांचा प्रभाव आहे

lines.value: कोपेनच्या kopen हवामान वर्गीकरणानुसार उष्ण कटिबंधातील सरासरी तापमान १९° सेल्सिअस इतके असते
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: त्या शाखा म्हणजे इतिहास कलेचा इतिहास वैज्ञानिक शास्त्रे भूगर्भशास्त्र तसेच भाषाशास्त्र भौतिकशास्त्र माहिती विज्ञान रसायन शास्त्र संख्याशास्त्र जीवशास्त्राच्या इतर शाखा पुरापर्यावरणशास्त्र(paleoecology paleontology पुराप्राणिशास्त्र(paleozoology paleoethnobotany व पुराजीव शास्त्र(paleobotany
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: soon the early archaeologists began to investigate various areas around the world with the study of ancient aegean civilization being stimulated by the excavations of heinrich schliemann at troy and of arthur evans at crete whilst john lloyd stephens was a pivotal figure in the rediscovery of माया सभ्यता throughout central america
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: however the methodologies employed by these archaeologists were highly flawed by today's standards often having a eurocentric bias and many early european archaeologists often relied on anthropological and ethnographic accounts provided by the likes of edward tylor and lewis henry morgan thereby comparing contemporary savage peoples like the native americans with the historical peoples of europe who lived in similar societies
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: soon the new discipline of archaeology spread to north america where it was taken up by figures like samuel haven and william henry holmes whom excavated ancient native american monuments
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: however it is not only prehistoric pre literate cultures which can be studied using archaeology but historic literate cultures as well through the sub discipline of historical archaeology
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: for many literate cultures such as ancient greece and mesopotamia their surviving records are often incomplete and invariably biased to some extent
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: in many societies literacy was restricted to the elite classes such as the clergy or the bureaucracy of court or temple
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the literacy even of aristocrats has sometimes been restricted to deeds and contracts
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the interests and world view of elites are often quite different from the lives and interests of the populace
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: writings that were produced by people more representative of the general population were unlikely to find their way into libraries and be preserved there for posterity
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: thus written records tend to reflect the biases assumptions cultural values and possibly deceptions of a limited range of individuals usually a small fraction of the larger population
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: hence written records cannot be trusted as a sole source
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the material record is closer to a fair representation of society though it is subject to its own inaccuracies such as sampling bias and differential preservation
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: त्यापैकी एक भाग processual archaeology म्हणून ओळखला जाऊ लागला
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: christopher tilley daniel miller and ian hodder ती मोहीम पुढे post processual archaeology म्हणून ओळखली जाऊ लागली
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: archaeological theory now borrows from a wide range of influences including neo darwinian evolutionary thought phenomenology postmodernism agency theory cognitive science functionalism gender based and feminist archaeology and systems theory
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: as with other forms of non destructive archaeology survey avoids ethical issues of particular concern to descendant peoples associated with destroying a site through excavation
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: it is the only way to gather some forms of information such as settlement patterns and settlement structure
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: survey data are commonly assembled into maps which may show surface features and or artifact distribution
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: जरी काही पुरातत्त्वशास्त्रज्ञ धातु शोधक यंत्राचा वापर खजिन्याच्या शोधासाठी ग्राह्य धरतात?????तर काही त्यास सर्वांत परिणामकारक अवजार समजतात.although some archaeologists consider the use of metal detectors to be tantamount to treasure hunting others deem them an effective tool in archaeological surveying
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: examples of formal archaeological use of metal detectors include musketball distribution analysis on english civil war battlefields metal distribution analysis prior to excavation of a nineteenth century ship wreck and service cable location during evaluation
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: metal detectorists have also contributed to the archaeological record where they have made detailed records of their results and refrained from raising artifacts from their archaeological context
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: in the uk metal detectorists have been solicited for involvement in the portable antiquities scheme
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: regional survey in underwater archaeology uses geophysical or remote sensing devices such as marine magnetometer side scan sonar or sub bottom sonar
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: archaeological excavation existed even when the field was still the domain of amateurs and it remains the source of the majority of data recovered in most field projects
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: it can reveal several types of information usually not accessible to survey such as stratigraphy three dimensional structure and verifiably primary context
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: modern excavation techniques require that the precise locations of objects and features known as their provenance or provenience be recorded
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: this always involves determining their horizontal locations and sometimes vertical position as well also see primary laws of archaeology
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: similarly their association or relationship with nearby objects and features needs to be recorded for later analysis
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: this allows the archaeologist to deduce what artifacts and features were likely used together and which may be from different phases of activity
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: for example excavation of a site reveals its stratigraphy if a site was occupied by a succession of distinct cultures artifacts from more recent cultures will lie above those from more ancient cultures
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: excavation is the most expensive phase of archaeological research in relative terms
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: also as a destructive process it carries ethical concerns
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: as a result very few sites are excavated in their entirety
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: again the percentage of a site excavated depends greatly on the country and method statement issued
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: in places 90% excavation is common
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: sampling is even more important in excavation than in survey
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: it is common for large mechanical equipment such as backhoes jcbs to be used in excavation especially to remove the topsoil overburden though this method is increasingly used with great caution
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: following this rather dramatic step the exposed area is usually hand cleaned with trowels or hoes to ensure that all features are apparent
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the next task is to form a site plan and then use it to help decide the method of excavation
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: features dug into the natural subsoil are normally excavated in portions in order to produce a visible archaeological section for recording
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: a feature for example a pit or a ditch consists of two parts the cut and the fill
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the cut describes the edge of the feature where the feature meets the natural soil
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: it is the feature's boundary
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the fill is understandably what the feature is filled with and will often appear quite distinct from the natural soil
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the cut and fill are given consecutive numbers for recording purposes
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: scaled plans and sections of individual features are all drawn on site black and white and colour photographs of them are taken and recording sheets are filled in describing the context of each
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: all this information serves as a permanent record of the now destroyed archaeology and is used in describing and interpreting the site
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: once artifacts and structures have been excavated or collected from surface surveys it is necessary to properly study them to gain as much data as possible
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: this process is known as post excavation analysis and is normally the most time consuming part of the archaeological investigation
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: it is not uncommon for the final excavation reports on major sites to take years to be published
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: at its most basic the artifacts found are cleaned catalogued and compared to published collections in order to classify them typologically and to identify other sites with similar artifact assemblages
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: however a much more comprehensive range of analytical techniques are available through archaeological science meaning that artifacts can be dated and their compositions examined
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the bones plants and pollen collected from a site can all be analyzed using the techniques of zooarchaeology paleoethnobotany and palynology while any texts can usually be deciphered
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: these techniques frequently provide information that would not otherwise be known and therefore contribute greatly to the understanding of a site
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: some time around 1995 archaeologists started using computer graphics to build virtual 3d models of sites such as the throne roome of an ancient assyrian palace or ancient rome
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: this is done by collecting normal photographs and using computer graphics to build the virtual 3d model
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: more generally computers can be used to recreate the environment and conditions of the past such as objects buildings landscapes and even ancient battles
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: computer simulation can be used to simulate the living conditions of an ancient community and to see how it would have reacted to various scenarios such as how much food to grow how many animals to slaughter etc computer built topographical models have been combined with astronomical calculations to verify whether or not certain structures such as pillars were aligned with astronomical events such as the sun's position at a solstice
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: as with most academic disciplines there are a very large number of archaeological sub disciplines characterised by a specific method or type of material e.g lithic analysis music archaeobotany geographical or chronological focus e.g near eastern archaeology medieval archaeology other thematic concern e.g maritime archaeology landscape archaeology battlefield archaeology or a specific archaeological culture or civilisation e.g egyptology indology sinology
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: historical archaeology is the study of cultures with some form of writing
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: in इंग्लंड archaeologists have uncovered the long lost layouts of medieval villages abandoned after the crises of the 14th century and the equally lost layouts of 17th century parterre gardens swept away by a change in fashion
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: in downtown new york city archaeologists have exhumed the 18th century remains of the african burial ground
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: ethnoarchaeology is the archaeological study of living people
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the approach gained notoriety during the emphasis on middle range theory that was a feature of the processual movement of the 1960s
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: early ethnoarchaeological research focused on hunting and gathering or foraging societies
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: ethnoarchaeology continues to be a vibrant component of post processual and other current archaeological approaches
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: ethnoarchaeology is the use of ethnography to increase and improve analogs which are then used as analogies to interpret the archaeological record
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: in short ethnoarchaeology is the application of ethnography to archaeology
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: experimental archaeology represents the application of the experimental method to develop more highly controlled observations of processes that create and impact the archaeological record
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: in the context of the logical positivism of processualism with its goals of improving the scientific rigor of archaeological epistemologies the experimental method gained importance
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: experimental techniques remain a crucial component to improving the inferential frameworks for interpreting the archaeological record
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: archaeometry is a field of study that aims to systematize archaeological measurement
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: it emphasizes the application of analytical techniques from physics chemistry and engineering
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: it is a lively field of research that frequently focuses on the definition of the chemical composition of archaeological remains for source analysis
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: a relatively nascent subfield is that of archaeological materials designed to enhance understanding of prehistoric and non industrial culture through scientific analysis of the structure and properties of materials associated with human activity
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: while archaeology can be done as a pure science it can also be an applied science namely the study of archaeological sites that are threatened by development
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: in such cases archaeology is a subsidiary activity within cultural resources management crm also called heritage management in the united kingdom
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: today crm accounts for most of the archaeological research done in the united states and much of that in western europe as well
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: in the us crm archaeology has been a growing concern since the passage of the national historic preservation act nhpa of 1966 and most taxpayers scholars and politicians believe that crm has helped preserve much of that nation's history and prehistory that would have otherwise been lost in the expansion of cities dams and highways
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: along with other statutes the nhpa mandates that projects on federal land or involving federal funds or permits consider the effects of the project on each archaeological site
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the application of crm in the united kingdom is not limited to government funded projects
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: since 1990 ppg 16 has required planners to consider archaeology as a material consideration in determining applications for new development
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: as a result numerous archaeological organisations undertake mitigation work in advance of or during construction work in archaeologically sensitive areas at the developer's expense
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: in england ultimate responsibility of care for the historic environment rests with the department for culture media and sport in association with english heritage
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: in scotland wales and northern ireland the same responsibilities lie with historic scotland cadw and the northern ireland environment agency respectively
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: among the goals of crm are the identification preservation and maintenance of cultural sites on public and private lands and the removal of culturally valuable materials from areas where they would otherwise be destroyed by human activity such as proposed construction
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: this study involves at least a cursory examination to determine whether or not any significant archaeological sites are present in the area affected by the proposed construction
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: if these do exist time and money must be allotted for their excavation
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: if initial survey and or test excavation indicates the presence of an extraordinarily valuable site the construction may be prohibited entirely
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: crm is a thriving entity especially in the united states and europe where archaeologists from private companies and all levels of government engage in the practice of their discipline
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: cultural resources management has however been criticized
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: crm is conducted by private companies that bid for projects by submitting proposals outlining the work to be done and an expected budget
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: it is not unheardof for the agency responsible for the construction to simply choose the proposal that asks for the least funding
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: crm archaeologists face considerable time pressure often being forced to complete their work in a fraction of the time that might be allotted for a purely scholarly endeavour
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: compounding the time pressure is the vetting process of site reports which are required in the us to be submitted by crm firms to the appropriate state historic preservation office shpo
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: from the shpo's perspective there is to be no difference between a report submitted by a crm firm operating under a deadline and a multi year academic project
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the end result is that for a cultural resource management archaeologist to be successful they must be able to produce academic quality documents at a corporate world pace
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the annual ratio of open academic archaeology positions inclusive of post doc temporary and non tenure track appointments to the annual number of archaeology ma/msc and phd students is grossly disproportionate
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: this dearth of academic positions causes a predictable excess of well educated individuals who join the ranks of the following year's crop of non academically employed archaeologists
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: cultural resource management once considered an intellectual backwater for individuals with strong backs and weak minds has reaped the benefit of this massive pool of well educated professionals
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: this results in crm offices increasingly staffed by advance degreed individuals with a track record of producing scholarly articles but who have the notches on their trowels to show they have been in the trenches as a shovelbum
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: early archaeology was largely an attempt to uncover spectacular artifacts and features or to explore vast and mysterious abandoned cities
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: such pursuits continue to fascinate the public
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: books films and video games such as the city of brass king solomon's mines indiana jones tomb raider the mummy and relic hunter all testify to the public's interest in the discovery aspect of archaeology
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: much thorough and productive research has indeed been conducted in dramatic locales such as copan and the valley of the kings but the bulk of activities and finds of modern archaeology are not so sensational
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: archaeological adventure stories tend to ignore the painstaking work involved in carrying out modern survey excavation and data processing
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: some archaeologists refer to such portrayals as pseudoarchaeology
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: archaeology has been portrayed in the mainstream media in sensational ways
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: this has its advantages and disadvantages
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: many practitioners point to the childhood excitement of indiana jones films and tomb raider video games as the inspiration for them to enter the field
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: archaeologists are also very much reliant on public support the question of exactly who they are doing their work for is often discussed
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: motivated by a desire to halt looting curb pseudoarchaeology and to help preserve archaeological sites through education and fostering public appreciation for the importance of archaeological heritage archaeologists are mounting public outreach campaigns
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: they seek to stop looting by combatting people who illegally take artifacts from protected sites and by alerting people who live near archaeological sites of the threat of looting
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: common methods of public outreach include press releases and the encouragement of school field trips to sites under excavation by professional archaeologists
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: public appreciation of the significance of archaeology and archaeological sites often leads to improved protection from encroaching development or other threats
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: one audience for archaeologists work is the public
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: they increasingly realize that their work can benefit non academic and non archaeological audiences and that they have a responsibility to educate and inform the public about archaeology
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: local heritage awareness is aimed at increasing civic and individual pride through projects such as community excavation projects and better public presentations of archaeological sites and knowledge
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the u.s.dept of agriculture forest service(usfs operates a volunteer archaeology and historic preservation program called the passport in time pit
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: volunteers work with professional usfs archaeologists and historians on national forests throughout the us volunteers are involved in all aspects of professional archaeology under expert supervision
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: in the uk popular archaeology programs such as time team and meet the ancestors have resulted in a huge upsurge in public interest
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: where possible archaeologists now make more provisions for public involvement and outreach in larger projects than they once did and many local archaeological organizations operate within the community archaeology framework to expand public involvement in smaller scale more local projects
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: archaeological excavation however is best undertaken by well trained staff that can work quickly and accurately
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: often this requires observing the necessary health and safety and indemnity insurance issues involved in working on a modern building site with tight deadlines
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: certain charities and local government bodies sometimes offer places on research projects either as part of academic work or as a defined community project
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: there is also a flourishing industry selling places on commercial training excavations and archaeological holiday tours
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: archaeologists prize local knowledge and often liaise with local historical and archaeological societies which is one reason why community archaeology projects are starting to become more common
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: often archaeologists are assisted by the public in the locating of archaeological sites which professional archaeologists have neither the funding nor the time to do
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: pseudoarchaeology is an umbrella term for all activities that claim to be archaeological but in fact violate commonly accepted and scientific archaeological practices
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: it includes much fictional archaeological work discussed above as well as some actual activity
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: many non fiction authors have ignored the scientific methods of processual archaeology or the specific critiques of it contained in post processualism
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: an example of this type is the writing of erich von daniken
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: his 1968 book chariots of the gods together with many subsequent lesser known works expounds a theory of ancient contacts between human civilisation on earth and more technologically advanced extraterrestrial civilisations
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: this theory known as palaeocontact theory or ancient astronaut theory is not exclusively daniken's nor did the idea originate with him
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: works of this nature are usually marked by the renunciation of well established theories on the basis of limited evidence and the interpretation of evidence with a preconceived theory in mind
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: looting of archaeological sites is an ancient problem
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: for instance many of the tombs of the egyptian pharaohs were looted during antiquity
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: archaeology stimulates interest in ancient objects and people in search of artifacts or treasure cause damage to archaeological sites
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the commercial and academic demand for artifacts unfortunately contributes directly to the illicit antiquities trade
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: smuggling of antiquities abroad to private collectors has caused great cultural and economic damage in many countries whose governments lack the resources and or the will to deter it
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: looters damage and destroy archaeological sites denying future generations information about their ethnic and cultural heritage
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: indigenous peoples especially lose access to and control over their cultural resources ultimately denying them the opportunity to know their past
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: popular consciousness often associates looting with poor third world countries but this is a false assumption
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: a lack of financial resources and political will are chronic worldwide problems inhibiting more effective protection of archaeological sites
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: many native american indians today such as vine deloria jr consider any removal of cultural artifacts from a native american indian site to be theft and much of professional archaeology as academic looting
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: in 1937 w f hodge the director of the southwest museum in los angeles ca released a statement that the museum would no longer purchase or accept collections from looted contexts
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the first conviction of the transport of artifacts illegally removed from private property under the archaeological resources protection act arpa public law 96-95 93 statute 721 16 usc 470aamm was in 1992 in the state of indiana
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: in the united states examples such as the case of kennewick man have illustrated the tensions between native americans and archaeologists which can be summarized as a conflict between a need to remain respectful towards burials sacred sites and the academic benefit from studying them
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: for years american archaeologists dug on indian burial grounds and other places considered sacred removing artifacts and human remains to storage facilities for further study
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: in some cases human remains were not even thoroughly studied but instead archived rather than reburied
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: furthermore western archaeologists views of the past often differ from those of tribal peoples
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the west views time as linear for many natives it is cyclic
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: from a western perspective the past is long gone from a native perspective disturbing the past can have dire consequences in the present
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: as a consequence of this american indians attempted to prevent archaeological excavation of sites inhabited by their ancestors while american archaeologists believed that the advancement of scientific knowledge was a valid reason to continue their studies
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: this contradictory situation was addressed by the native american graves protection and repatriation act nagpra 1990 which sought to reach a compromise by limiting the right of research institutions to possess human remains
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: due in part to the spirit of postprocessualism some archaeologists have begun to actively enlist the assistance of indigenous peoples likely to be descended from those under study
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: archaeologists have also been obliged to reexamine what constitutes an archaeological site in view of what native peoples believe to constitute sacred space
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: to many native peoples natural features such as lakes mountains or even individual trees have cultural significance
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: australian archaeologists especially have explored this issue and attempted to survey these sites in order to give them some protection from being developed
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: such work requires close links and trust between archaeologists and the people they are trying to help and at the same time study
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: while this cooperation presents a new set of challenges and hurdles to fieldwork it has benefits for all parties involved
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: tribal elders cooperating with archaeologists can prevent the excavation of areas of sites that they consider sacred while the archaeologists gain the elders aid in interpreting their finds
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: there have also been active efforts to recruit aboriginal peoples directly into the archaeological profession
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: :see repatriation and reburial of human remains a new trend in the heated controversy between first nations groups and scientists is the repatriation of native artifacts to the original descendants
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: an example of this occurred june 21 2005 when community members and elders from a number of the 10 algonquian nations in the ottawa area convened on the kitigan zibi reservation near maniwaki quebec to inter ancestral human remains and burial goods - some dating back 6000 years
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: it was not determined however if the remains were directly related to the algonquin people who now inhabit the region
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the remains may be of iroquoian ancestry since iroquoian people inhabited the area before the algonquin
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: alternatively the oldest of these remains might have no relation at all to the algonquin or iroquois and belong to an earlier culture who previously inhabited the area
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: the remains and artifacts including jewelry tools and weapons were originally excavated from various sites in the ottawa valley including morrison and the allumette islands
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: they had been part of the canadian museum of civilization's research collection for decades some since the late 1800s
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: elders from various algonquin communities conferred on an appropriate reburial eventually deciding on traditional redcedar and birchbark boxes lined with redcedar chips muskrat and beaver pelts
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: now an inconspicuous rock mound marks the reburial site where close to 90 boxes of various sizes are buried no further scientific study is possible
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: although negotiations were at times tense between the kitigan zibi community and museum they were able to reach agreement
lines.name: Marathi

lines.value: kennewick man is another repatriation candidate that has been the source of heated debate
lines.name: Marathi
